intro: Eriochlamys knappii, commonly known as Knapp's goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are alternate and lance-shaped, with a rough texture. Eriochlamys knappii is often found in open grasslands and is a member of the genus Eriochlamys, which includes several species with similar botanical features.
